Increasing Investor Opportunities Act
This bill allows a closed-end fundâ€”a portfolio of pooled assets with a limited number of shares traded on an exchangeâ€”to increase its investment in private investment funds. Specifically, the Securities and Exchange Commission is prohibited from limiting the sale or listing of securities of a closed-end fund that invests in private investment funds. This bill also apples to a closed-end company treated as a business development company.
